units.title: Prepare HBSS/BSA/glucose + DNase dish
units.text:
Obtain a 60 mm cell culture dish containing ~7 mL of HBSS/BSA/glucose.
Add 150 µL of pre-aliquoted DNase (10 mg/mL) to each dish.
units.rationale: This step prepares the digestion medium with DNase to prevent DNA-mediated clumping during tissue dissociation.

units.title: Cut brain tissue into small chunks
units.text: With a scalpel, cut tissue into small (~2 mm × 2 mm chunks) in HBSS/BSA/glucose + DNase solution in a sterile environment (Fig. 2).
units.rationale: Small tissue chunks increase surface area for efficient enzymatic digestion.

units.title: Distribute tissue and add collagenase/dispase
units.text:
Distribute tissue into three 15 mL conical tubes.
• Aliquot the tissue–buffer solution in the dish into the tubes first
• Use extra HBSS/BSA/glucose buffer to wash the dish and make up to 5 mL per tube
Add 167 µL of collagenase/dispase (100 mg/mL) to each tube.
units.rationale: This ensures uniform enzyme concentration and complete tissue digestion across samples.

units.title: Digest tissue in rotating oven
units.text: Digest for 30 min in rotating oven at 37 °C.
units.rationale: Controlled temperature and rotation optimize enzymatic digestion for cell yield.

units.title: Spin down digestion mixture
units.rationale: Centrifugation pellets cells after digestion while preserving viability.

units.title: Prepare Percoll density gradient
units.text:
Obtain two additional 15 mL conical tubes per each sample tube.
Dispense 4 mL of 22% Percoll into each new conical tube.
Carefully dispense cell suspension from each sample tube into the new conical tubes containing 22% Percoll in equal amounts. Use ~750 µL per tube.
units.rationale: Percoll gradient separates cell types by density, enriching target populations.

units.title: Centrifuge Percoll gradient
units.text: Spin down for 10 min at 500g, 4 °C with no deceleration.
units.rationale: High-speed centrifugation without deceleration preserves layer integrity for optimal cell separation.

units.title: Combine Percoll fractions and re-spin
units.text:
Reunite contents of all Percoll tubes into one tube by resuspending the cell pellet in the HBSS/BSA/glucose remaining after pouring out the supernatant.
Spin down the sample tube for 5 min at 300g, 4 °C.
units.rationale: Pooling fractions maximizes cell recovery before immunostaining.

units.title: Prepare master mix for immunostaining
units.text:
Add 200 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose into a fresh tube.
Add 2 µL of each antibody and 1 µL of DAPI into the tube containing 200 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose per sample.
units.rationale: Master mix ensures consistent antibody and dye concentrations across all samples.

units.title: Immunostain cells and prepare for FACS
units.text:
Resuspend in ~200 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose.
Add the master mix into the tube of resuspended cells.
Incubate for 15 min on ice.
Wash with 5 mL of HBSS/BSA/glucose and mix.
Spin down for 5 min at 300g, 4 °C.
Discard supernatant.
Resuspend cells.
Obtain one FACS tube and a 70 µm filter.
With the filter over the FACS tube, dispense the resuspended cells through the filter and into the FACS tube.
Seal the tube and place on ice.
units.rationale: This sequence ensures specific antibody binding, removes unbound reagents, and prepares viable single cells for flow cytometry.
